summary: This document appears to be an excerpt from a trust agreement or financial instrument outlining the broad powers granted to a trustee, including acquiring and retaining property without diversification, holding securities in nominee names, employing various professionals, borrowing and lending money, and distributing income or principal. It is part of the Epstein-related financial document set.
keyFacts: The document outlines extensive financial powers granted to a trustee, including the ability to acquire and retain property without regard to diversification principles.
It authorizes the trustee to hold securities in the names of nominees, which can obscure true ownership.
The trustee is empowered to employ attorneys, accountants, investment advisers, brokers, and other professionals, and can compensate them, including if the trustee themselves is part of such a firm.

The trustee has broad borrowing and lending powers, including the ability to lend to beneficiaries (even if the beneficiary is also a trustee) and to lend between income and principal accounts without interest.
Distributions of income or principal can be made in cash or in kind to trustees, beneficiaries, or remaindermen.
